metadata.chief_complaint: asthma follow-up, on 3 controllers, needs refills and action plan update

script.speaker: doctor
script.text: Hi, Jackson's here for his asthma check. How's he been doing?

script.speaker: parent
script.text: Really well actually. No flares since his last visit. He even made it through cold season without needing prednisone.

script.speaker: doctor
script.text: That's great to hear. Let me review his medications. He's on Flovent 110 two puffs twice daily, Singulair 5 milligrams at bedtime, and albuterol as needed?

script.speaker: parent
script.text: Yes, that's right. Oh, and we added Flonase for his allergies. The allergist suggested it.

script.speaker: doctor
script.text: Good, nasal steroids can help with asthma too by controlling the upper airway inflammation. How often is he needing the albuterol?

script.speaker: parent
script.text: Hardly ever. Maybe once a month if he runs around a lot.

script.speaker: doctor
script.text: That's excellent. Less than twice a week is our goal for rescue inhaler use. He's well below that.

script.speaker: parent
script.text: Should we try to step down his medications since he's doing so well?

script.speaker: doctor
script.text: It's tempting, but I'd like to keep him stable through spring allergy season first. Let's reassess in June. If he's still doing well, we can try stepping down the Flovent.

script.speaker: parent
script.text: That makes sense. I don't want to rock the boat.

script.speaker: doctor
script.text: Let me listen to his lungs.

script.speaker: doctor
script.text: Deep breath buddy. And another. Lungs are crystal clear. No wheezing at all.

script.speaker: parent
script.text: Music to my ears.

script.speaker: doctor
script.text: I need to update his asthma action plan for school. Let me go through it with you.

script.speaker: parent
script.text: Yes, they need a new one every year.

script.speaker: doctor
script.text: Green zone, when he's doing well: continue Flovent two puffs twice daily and Singulair at bedtime. No albuterol needed.

script.speaker: doctor
script.text: Yellow zone, if he's coughing, wheezing, or short of breath: give albuterol two puffs, can repeat every four hours. Continue Flovent and Singulair. Call us if needing albuterol more than every four hours.

script.speaker: doctor
script.text: Red zone, if albuterol isn't helping, lips look blue, or he can't talk in full sentences: give albuterol and call 911.

script.speaker: parent
script.text: Got it. Same as before basically.

script.speaker: doctor
script.text: Exactly. I'll print you a new copy for the school. Now, do you need refills?

script.speaker: parent
script.text: Yes, everything. We're running low on all of them.

script.speaker: doctor
script.text: I'll send Flovent 110, one inhaler, 90-day supply. Singulair 5 milligrams, 90-day supply. And albuterol, two inhalers so you have one for home and one for school.

script.speaker: parent
script.text: What about the Flonase?

script.speaker: doctor
script.text: That's over the counter now, so you can just buy it at the pharmacy. But keep using it daily through allergy season.

script.speaker: parent
script.text: Oh right, I forgot. When do we come back?

script.speaker: doctor
script.text: Let's do three months, so late spring. We'll see how allergy season treats him and talk about stepping down then.

script.speaker: parent
script.text: Perfect. Thank you, Doctor.

script.speaker: doctor
script.text: Keep up the good work. He's doing great.
